case_vignette: A 55-year-old male with past medica   l history of Jewish ancestry presents with painful oral lesions and few "waterboils" on the arms for the past three months.    His only    medications include multivitamin and  atorvastatin which    he has been on for the past 15 years wi thout any dosage changes. He denies any recent travel or genital uclers. A full skin exam   ination is remarkable for irregularly shaped e rosions of the buccal and palatine mucosa and scattered flaccid bullae on the arms with few scattered cru   sted   erosions. A biopsy of a bulla on the arm is p   erformed and demonstrates suprabasilar acan  tholysis with vertically oriented basal keratinocytes    with the   acantholysis involving hair follicles.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painful oral lesions and some blisters that look like water boils on my arms.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms for the past three months.
Do the lesions and blisters appear and heal in cycles or have they been persistent since onset?
They have been persistent since onset.
Have you experienced any fever or general illness along with the lesions and blisters?
No, I haven't experienced any fever or general illness along with the lesions and blisters.
Do you have any known allergies or recent exposure to new medications, foods, or environmental factors?
No, I haven't had any recent exposure to new medications, foods, or environmental factors, and I don't have any known allergies.
Is there any history of similar symptoms in your family?
I don't have any history of similar symptoms in my family.
Have you noticed any relation between the appearance of symptoms and stress or certain types of foods?
No, I haven't noticed any relation between the appearance of symptoms and stress or certain types of foods.
Have you used any treatment or medication for your symptoms? If so, what was the response?
I haven't used any specific treatment or medication for these symptoms apart from my regular multivitamin and atorvastatin.
Final Diagnosis: Pemphigus Vulgaris
